meanings.definition: Involve (someone) deeply in an argument, conflict, or difficult situation.
meanings.sent1: She didn't want to be embroiled in their fight.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were embroiled in a heated debate.
meanings.sent3: The cat's embroilment in the yarn led to a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to mediate only further embroiled the situation.
meanings.sent5: The detective's questions embroiled the suspect in a web of lies.

meanings.sent1: The embroilment of the project caused delays.
meanings.sent2: She tried to unravel the embroilment of the legal case.
meanings.sent3: The embroilment of the party guests' names made for a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The embroilment of emotions in her mind was like a stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The embroilment of wires under the desk was a nightmare to sort out.
